text: is the name of a Japanese artificial satellite put into orbit. The launch was a project of the Institute of Space and Astronautical Science of the University of Tokyo. The satellite was sent into orbit on February 22, 1989.JAXA, "Catalogue of ISAS Missions" . Retrieved 2012-4-2. Akebono was designed to study auroras and the magnetosphere of earth. The satellite remained operational for 20+ years. ==References== == Other websites == * Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA), Akebono (Exos-D) mission profile Category:Japanese satellites Category:1980s in spaceflight
title: Akebono (satellite)
